title.narrative: 4.2: ADVOCACY, ENGAGEMENT AND COMMUNITYPARTICIPATION FOR CHILD RIGHT

description.narrative: Communities in priority regions, including CSOs, women and youth advocate for child rights and participate in the planning, budgeting and monitoring of the delivery of social services for children to enhance national and local accountability and ownership. , which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys live in more-inclusive and resilient communities strengthened by an enabling environment and systems that createequitable chances in life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities in priority regions, including CSOs, women and youth advocate for child rights and participate in the planning,budgeting and monitoring of the delivery of social services for children to enhance national and local accountability and ownership.

description.narrative: As suggested by recent works on social protection and complementary services, the office used Social and behaviour change communication strategy to increase the potential to generate better and sustainable outcomes for children. This included capacities development efforts of existing network of community worker and Youth organizations across the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
